result.execSummary:
On one or more charges, the deferred prosecution or sentencing agreement(s) on this case were fulfilled, and the charge(s) were dismissed.

The defendant Amanda Josephine Fletcher was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Fraud/Innkeeper,etc-Nonpayment (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.21(1m)(a).
  • Fraud/Innkeeper,etc-Nonpayment (<=$2500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.21(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Counts to run concurrent.
Count 1 in Deferred Judgment of Conviction.
Court reads-in and dimisses Count 4.
Defendant to report to Probation by September 29, 2015.
Bond remains in effect until Defendant reports to Probation.


In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.

Concurrent with: Count 3

miscConds.notes:
$243.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF315.
$200.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 2 Case #14CF315.
Psychological/Psychiatric Evaluation within 30 days if requested.

-Restitution in the amount of $17325.35 (balance of $4280.50) will be paid directly to Victim within 2 days.
-Cooperate with any other Evaluation, Assessment and/or Program as directed by Agent.
-Defendant to provide a DNA sample.
-Apology letter to each member of the dance team and administration within 30 days and to be sent to the District Attorney's Office.
-Restorative Justice Program if Victim requests.
-Shall not coach/choreograph any team that competes in Hudson WI.
-Not to handle any funds for any volunteer orgranization.
-Follow all rules and regulations of Agent.
-Pay Supervision fees.

CO: Vlack, DAR: Frank, Clerk: Minot,ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Angela Raye Olson   DF:  Amanda Josephine Fletcher appeared. Atty Olson recites agreement. No objection from ADA Nieskes. Court amends Count two and three to 943.20(1)(a) Fraud of Keeper. Court reviews constitutional rights with def. Court finds Def freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights. Court reads charge and possible penalties for count one, amended count two and amended count three, Def pleads Guilty. Court uses complaints and reports as factual basis, accepts plea and adjudicates Def guilty of count one, amended count two and amended count three. Count withholds entering conviction on Count one in favor of Diversion Agreement. Court orders 2 years probation: 
Count #2 w/h
- 90 Days Jail STAYED
- Court Costs
- Restitution $17,325.35 will be paid directly to victim within 2 days
- DNA Surcharge; Apply Bond
- Psychological/ Psychiatric Evaluation if requested
- Cooperate with any other evaluation, assessment and/or program as requested
- DNA Sample and Surcharge
- Apology Letter to each member of the dance team and adminstration within 30 Days - To be sent through the DA's Office
- Restorative Justice if requested
- Sign up for probation by 9/29/2015 - Bond remains in effect until Def signs up for probation
- Shall not coach/Choregraph any team that competes with Hudson
- Not to handle any funds for any volunteer organization
- Pay Supervision Fees.
- Follow rules and regulations of Agent

Preliminary hearing on October 20, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Prior to leaving the courthouse, report to St Croix County Jail for mugshots and fingerprints.

It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations, Angela F., Lisa M., or Hudson School District Buildings.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
